Portfolio, Jamie Lloyd

Usted esta aqui

Hello! It's nice to meet you. You are here. GIT project is here.

I made assumptions about what a portfolio should be.

Then I wrote user stories, and prioritized an MVP. I researched everything, and simplified as I went. My desire was to create something I could achieve quickly without sacrificing the quality i've come to expect. But also to make it scalable and easy to add new features later.

Request:
Build myself a portfolio that encompasses years of work in a quick and easy to use presentation.

Solution:
As a developer, i've always had an eye for good designs and how to build them. Here, i've taken what I know and boiled it down into this presentation. The video's of each work sample were recorded with the intention to show the work the way I see it, for quick consumption and browsing.

Technologies:
Primarily, this site is built with Angular JS, CSS, HTML, JSON, + Node JS for testing with Karma and Protractor.

Git library:
You can find the git library here. It contains everything you need to run the app, with the exception of the video files. You can download those here if you want to run it locally. I've written instructions in the git readme file here to help get you started. Instructions are simple enough to get it set up. A familiarity with git, node, grunt is assumed.

Workflow:
I use Webstorm as my IDE, and I've configured the project to automate important tasks. There are unit & e2e tests for quick validation of underlying expectations. Grunt tasks for file watching, concatenation, minification, etc.

Known issues:
Currently the play button fade-in is triggered by the video player pause event. Click and hold the seek bar while a video is playing, and the play button fades-in over the top. The pause event is fired, and the seek event does not fire until the seek head is moved. It's not exactly broken, just doesn't look ideal.

Pending updates:
Database solution for project and case study data.
